column4: when I try to boot ubuntu, it tells me please insert bootable media
any ideas?
disable the cd media as a repo source then try again after refreshing/reloading your sources
you tried what I suggested yet? please pastebin your sources.list to see if that is the issue
until you do the steps we recommend then no real help possible
wat steps? I may have missed them
does your irc client have the scroll up function?
have to step out, perhaps someone can help you to disable cd media from your sources list
can you repost the steps
I've been trying, but nothing is working
there is a website called ubuntu-tutorials.com that has more on that
thanks
It only says what the ubuntu forum says
what is that? which site?
you reffered me to ubuntu-tutorials.com
unless you give some specific details of what you have tried, what worked and what did not, and what errors you have gotten, then you might not get much help here
My trackpad can't right click, my muc doesn't work, my wifi doesnt work
thats it i think
i never get errors, it just doesnt work
all of this problems are eminently fixable; many folks run ubuntu well on their macbooks/macbook pros; the first order of business is always wifi though
OK
can you help me get wifi working?
